metadata.Title: CVE-2012-4527 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in mcrypt 2.6.8 and earlier allowsuser-assisted remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) andpossibly execute arbitrary code via a long file name. NOTE: it is not clearwhether this is a vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4527` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mcrypt - 2.6.8-1.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mcrypt package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.8-1.3').
